intro: Erigeron kotschyi, commonly known as the desert fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron kotschyi is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
